caption:
Table 1. Performance comparison for 3D object detection on nuScenes dataset. mATE, mASE, mAOE, mAVE and mAAE stand for average 
translation, scale, orientation, velocity and attribute errors respectively. ↑ indicates that higher is better and ↓ indicates that lower is better. 
"C", "R" and "L" specify camera, radar and LIDAR modalities respectively.

↓ 
Method 
Dataset C R L NDS ↑ mAP ↑ mATE mASE mAOE mAVE mAAE 
InfoFocus [27] 
test 
0.395 0.395 0.363 0.265 1.132 1.000 0.395 
OFT [24] 
test 
0.212 0.126 0.820 0.360 0.850 1.730 0.480 
MonoDIS [26] 
test 
0.384 0.304 0.738 0.263 0.546 1.533 0.134 
CenterNet (HGLS) [34] 
test 
0.400 0.338 0.658 0.255 0.629 1.629 0.142 
Ours (DLA) 
test 
0.449 0.326 0.631 0.261 0.516 0.614 0.115 

CenterNet (DLA) [34] 
val 
0.328 0.306 0.716 0.264 0.609 1.426 0.658 
Ours (DLA) 
val 
0.453 0.332 0.649 0.263 0.535 0.540 0.142 

Table 2. Per-class performance comparison for 3D object detection on nuScenes dataset.

Table 3. Overall ablation study on nuScenes validation set. Improvement percentages in each row are relative to the baseline method. (PE: 
Pillar Expansion, FA: Frustum Association, FT: Flip Test)
